description.narrative: Capacity enhanced at state and district levels for planning, implementation, budgeting and public financial management for most disadvantaged children.

sector.narrative: Child marriage - surveys (e.g. KAP, VACS), data analysis/research/evaluation evidence generation, synthesis, and use
Country programme process (including UNDAF planning and CCA)
Delivery of cash transfers or voucher through new and/or parallel system (humanitarian context)
Development of multi-sectoral legislation/policies/strategies/action plans supporting development and participation of adolescents
ECD data, evidence, and knowledge generation and dissemination
HSS - public finance management for Health
Multisector aid for basic social services
PF4C - domestic revenue mobilization and access to finance for key social services
PF4C: Improving public expenditure effectiveness / efficiency
Situation Analysis or Update on women and children
Social and behaviour change communication on violence, exploitation and abuse
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration
Technical assistance - Maternal and newborn health

description.narrative: Development Partner affairs policy planning and administration
General Economic, Commercial and Labour Affairs policy, planning and administration
Other General Services support to civil society
Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities policy, planning and administration
Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities social services (incl youth development and women+ children)

title.narrative: UNICEF Programmes in India (Adolescent Development and Participation)
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
2017 India: Reducing Stunting in Children Under Five Years of Age: a comprehensive evaluation of UNICEF’s strategies and programme performance – India Country Case Study
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Capacity enhanced at state and district levels for planning, implementation, budgeting and public financial management for most disadvantaged children.
Degree to which sensitivity to priorities of the most deprived women and children are reflected in budgets of key national flagship programmes

baseline.value: Studies of 6 states and 4 flagship programmes

target.value: 2017:Studies of at least the same over 2 points in time

actual.value: 2014:Several states conducted child budgeting analysis at state and district level, with the aim of conducting advocacy at various levels of the state and local government. Karnataka disseminated public expenditure analysis for last ten years with stakeholders. Partnership established with Accountabilit

title.narrative: Extent to which national flagship programmes incorporate strategies to address trends and patterns of social exclusion, urbanization, and migration and their impacts on vulnerable women and children

baseline.value: Studies on social exclusion in 4 flagship schemes (SSA, RCH, TSC and ICDS) in 3 states

target.value: 2017:Analysis of strategies all 8 flagships in all programming states

actual.value: 2014:A national report on exclusion was disseminated and discussions in this context were undertaken with civil society, universities and governments. Multiple states undertook analysis of delivery of flagship programmes. Kerala undertook work on excluded tribal groups by giving support to GIS based mot
